message.content:
cs.CV, cs.RO, cs.GR, cs.LG, cs.AI 

The paper deals with the problem of dense 3D reconstruction for visual tunnel inspection using an unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV). The paper proposes a novel solution that exploits Structure-from-Motion, Bundle Adjustment, and available geometry priors to robustly estimate camera pose and automatically reconstruct a fully-dense 3D scene using the least possible number of images in various challenging tunnel-like environments. This work involves computer vision, robotics, graphics, and machine learning techniques, which are all relevant to the following arXiv CS sub-categories: 

- cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition): This sub-category deals with the theory and applications of computer vision and pattern recognition, which are essential for the proposed solution. 
- cs.RO (Robotics): This sub-category deals with the theory and applications of robotics, which are relevant to the use of UAV for tunnel inspection. 
- cs.GR (Graphics): This sub-category deals with the theory and applications of computer graphics, which are relevant to the reconstruction and texture mapping of the 3D scene. 
- cs.LG (Machine Learning): This sub-category deals with the theory and applications of machine learning, which are relevant to the use of available geometry priors for robust camera pose estimation. 
- cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence): This sub-category deals with the theory and applications of artificial intelligence, which are relevant to the use of UAV for remote
